abstract: General Electric‘s real estate unit agreed to buy office and industrial buildings in Canada from Dundee Real Estate Investment Trust for about 2.4 billion Canadian dollars ($2.3 billion) and will purchase an 18 percent stake in the company. The purchase, which gives G.E. a toehold in faster-growing markets to tap global demand, includes 180 properties located primarily in Ontario, Quebec and Newfoundland.
lead_paragraph: General Electric‘s real estate unit agreed to buy office and industrial buildings in Canada from Dundee Real Estate Investment Trust for about 2.4 billion Canadian dollars ($2.3 billion) and will purchase an 18 percent stake in the company. The purchase, which gives G.E. a toehold in faster-growing markets to tap global demand, includes 180 properties located primarily in Ontario, Quebec and Newfoundland.

headline.main: GE to Buy Canadian Assets from Dundee REIT
